title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement Taylor Rodgers. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Rodgers T, Mason L (2024). voxanalysis: VOX Analysis. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://free-state-analytics.github.io/voxanalysis/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {voxanalysis: VOX Analysis},   author = {Taylor Rodgers and Lee Mason},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://free-state-analytics.github.io/voxanalysis/}, }

title: VOX Analysis
text: voxanalysis R package R Shiny application autism spectrum diagnosis. provides user-interface allows user inputs following VOX Analysis evaluation process defined . data visualization functions also available analysts use custom requirements.

title: VOX Analysis
text: can install development version voxanalysis like :
code: # If devtools is not installed, first install it install.packages("devtools")  # Install PackageName from GitHub devtools::install_github("Free-State-Analytics/voxanalysis")

title: VOX Analysis
text: can launch application running:

title: Cochran's Q test — calc_cochran_qtest
text: heavily based Cochran's Q Test `RVAideMemoire` package. several dependency issues package, re-written built-function package modification.

title: Cochran's Q test — calc_cochran_qtest
Cochran's Q test — calc_cochran_qtest
text: formula formula pass . app currently uses `value ~ name | referent`. data `data.frame` containing `Conversing`, `Labeling`, `Echoing`, `Requesting`. Must `pivot_longer` applied, `name` `value` two new columns. alpha alpha level. p.method p method. Recommend "fdr".

text: Produces data.frame prompt hierarchy

title: Calculate the speaker's SCoRE — calc_speakers_SCoRE
Calculate the speaker's SCoRE — calc_speakers_SCoRE
text: df_summarized_response `data.frame` sums verbal operant column (.e., conversing, echoing, etc.) given evaluation date. See `summarize_response` produce.

title: Calculate the speaker's SCoRE — calc_speakers_SCoRE
code: data("df_summarized_response_example")  ## Function only works with one date at a time dat <- df_summarized_response_example %>%     filter(date_of_evaluation == max(date_of_evaluation)) calc_speakers_SCoRE(df_summarized_response = dat) #> Error in calc_speakers_SCoRE(df_summarized_response = dat): could not find function "calc_speakers_SCoRE"

title: Common parameters — common-params
text: Common parameters found throughout language assessment package.

title: Common parameters — common-params
text: id namespace id. df_input_response `data.frame` containing referent names response. Run `data("df_input_response_example")` `data("df_input_response_previous_example")` example. df_summarized_response `data.frame` sums verbal operant column (.e., conversing, echoing, etc.) given evaluation date. See `summarize_response` produce. df_input_speaker_info `data.frame` contains general info speaker, provided user. Run `data("df_input_speaker_info")` produce example.

title: Speaker Response Inputs (Example) — df_input_response_example
text: data set shows structure expected `df_input_response`, common data set generated language assessment application.

title: Speaker Response Inputs (Example) — df_input_response_example
Speaker Response Inputs (Example) — df_input_response_example
text: data frame 7 rows 6 variables: date_of_evaluation date evaluation. referent Name referent associated response. conversing Indicates whether speaker provided thematic response object (1 = Yes, 0 = ). labeling Indicates whether speaker label object (1 = Yes, 0 = ). echoing Indicates whether speaker repeat object name (1 = Yes, 0 = ). requesting Indicates whether speaker request object name (1 = Yes, 0 = ).

title: Speaker Response Inputs (Example) — df_input_response_example
text: entry 1 0, indicates whether speaker responded referent.

title: Response Inputs Previous (Example) — df_input_response_previous_example
text: sample data set similar `df_input_response_example`, contains two previous set evaluations. useful producing examples plots analysis containing previous evaluation dates.

title: Response Inputs Previous (Example) — df_input_response_previous_example
Response Inputs Previous (Example) — df_input_response_previous_example
text: data frame 7 rows 6 variables: date_of_evaluation date evaluation. referent Name referent associated response. conversing Indicates whether speaker provided thematic response object (1 = Yes, 0 = ). labeling Indicates whether speaker label object (1 = Yes, 0 = ). echoing Indicates whether speaker repeat object name (1 = Yes, 0 = ). requesting Indicates whether speaker request object name (1 = Yes, 0 = ).

title: Response Inputs Previous (Example) — df_input_response_previous_example
text: entry 1 0, indicates whether speaker responded referent.

title: Speaker Info (Example) — df_input_speaker_info_example
text: data set shows expected structure `df_input_speaker_info`, common input required function found package.

title: Speaker Info (Example) — df_input_speaker_info_example
Speaker Info (Example) — df_input_speaker_info_example
text: data frame 1 rows 4 variables: first_name Speaker's first name. last_name Speaker's last name. date_of_birth speaker's date birth. date_of_evaluation date evaluation. language_spoken language spoken evaluation. gender speaker's gender.

title: Export Data (Example) — df_output_exportable_example
text: data set resembles export evaluation. data re-imported append new data need follow structure.

title: Export Data (Example) — df_output_exportable_example
Export Data (Example) — df_output_exportable_example
text: data frame 7 rows 9 variables: first_name Speaker's first name. last_name Speaker's last name. date_of_birth speaker's date birth. language_spoken language spoken evaluation. gender speaker's gender. date_of_evaluation date evaluation. referent Name referent associated response. conversing binary indicator showing whether speaker provided thematic response object (1 = Yes, 0 = ). labeling binary indicator showing whether speaker label object (1 = Yes, 0 = ). echoing binary indicator showing whether speaker repeat object name (1 = Yes, 0 = ). requesting binary indicator showing whether speaker request object name (1 = Yes, 0 = ).

what: A module for a download bar — mod_download_bar
title: A module for a download bar — mod_download_bar
text: Shiny module allow user download exportable data set word doc report.

title: A module for a download bar — mod_download_bar
code: mod_download_bar_server(   id,   df_input_speaker_info,   df_input_response,   df_summarized_response )  mod_download_bar_ui(id)

title: A module for a download bar — mod_download_bar
text: id namespace id. df_input_speaker_info `data.frame` contains general info speaker, provided user. Run `data("df_input_speaker_info")` produce example. df_input_response `data.frame` containing referent names response. Run `data("df_input_response_example")` `data("df_input_response_previous_example")` example. df_summarized_response `data.frame` sums verbal operant column (.e., conversing, echoing, etc.) given evaluation date. See `summarize_response` produce.

title: A module for a download bar — mod_download_bar
code: if (interactive()) { data("df_input_speaker_info_example") data("df_input_response_example") data("df_summarized_response_example")  ui <- page(   mod_download_bar_ui("download_bar") )  server <- function(input, output, session) {    mod_download_bar_server(     "download_bar",     df_input_speaker_info = df_input_speaker_info_example,     df_input_response = df_input_response_example,     df_summarized_response = df_summarized_response_example)  }  shinyApp(ui, server) }

title: A Shiny module to enter speaker data and render a report — mod_response_entry
text: id namespace id. df_input_speaker_info `data.frame` contains general info speaker, provided user. Run `data("df_input_speaker_info")` produce example.

title: A Shiny module to enter speaker data and render a report — mod_response_entry
code: if (interactive()) { data("df_input_speaker_info_example")  ui <- page(   useShinyjs(),   mod_response_entry_ui("data_entry") )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_response_entry_server("data_entry", df_input_speaker_info_example) }  } shinyApp(ui, server) #> Error in shinyApp(ui, server): could not find function "shinyApp"  if (interactive()) { ### Alternative run_example_measurment_entry_app() }

title: A Shiny module to generate a summary report based on the response inputs — mod_results_primary
A Shiny module to generate a summary report based on the response inputs — mod_results_primary
text: id namespace id. df_input_speaker_info `data.frame` contains general info speaker, provided user. Run `data("df_input_speaker_info")` produce example. df_input_response `data.frame` containing referent names response. Run `data("df_input_response_example")` `data("df_input_response_previous_example")` example.

title: A Shiny module to generate a summary report based on the response inputs — mod_results_primary
code: if (interactive()) {  data("df_input_speaker_info_example") data("df_input_response_example")  ui <- page(   mod_results_primary_ui("data_input") )  server <- function(input, output, session) {    mod_results_primary_server(     "data_input",     df_input_speaker_info = df_input_speaker_info_example,     df_input_response = df_input_response_example)  }  shinyApp(ui, server)  }  if (interactive()) { ### Alternative run_example_results_app()  }

code: if (interactive()) { data("df_input_response_example")  ui <- page(   mod_results_section_area_q_ui("section_area_q") )  server <- function(input, output, session) {    mod_results_section_area_q_server(     "section_area_q",     df_input_response_example,     v_primary_date = max(df_input_response_example$date_of_evaluation))  }  shinyApp(ui, server) }

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
text: Run Shiny Application

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
code: run_app(   onStart = NULL,   options = list(),   enableBookmarking = NULL,   uiPattern = "/",   ... )

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
text: onStart function called app actually run. needed shinyAppObj, since shinyAppDir case, global.R file can used purpose. options Named options passed runApp call (can following: "port", "launch.browser", "host", "quiet", "display.mode" "test.mode"). can also specify width height parameters provide hint embedding environment ideal height/width app. enableBookmarking Can one "url", "server", "disable". default value, NULL, respect setting previous calls  enableBookmarking(). See enableBookmarking() information bookmarking app. uiPattern regular expression applied GET request determine whether ui used handle request. Note entire request path must match regular expression order match considered successful. ... arguments pass golem_opts. See `?golem::get_golem_options` details.

code: data("df_summarized_response_example")  ## Table only works with one date at a time dat <- df_summarized_response_example %>%     filter(date_of_evaluation == max(date_of_evaluation)) table_prompt_hierarchy(df_summarized_response = dat) #> # A tibble: 14 × 5 #>    Percent Conversing Labeling Echoing Requesting #>      <dbl> <chr>      <chr>    <chr>   <chr>      #>  1   100   CELR       LERC     ELRC    RELC       #>  2    91.7 -          LER      ELR     REL        #>  3    83.3 CEL        LEC      ELC     -          #>  4    75   -          LE       EL      -          #>  5    66.7 CER        -        ERC     REC        #>  6    58.4 -          -        ER      RE         #>  7    58.3 CLR        LRC      -       RLC        #>  8    50   CE         LR       EC      RL         #>  9    41.7 -          -        E       -          #> 10    41.6 CL         LC       -       -          #> 11    33.3 -          L        -       -          #> 12    25   CR         -        -       RC         #> 13    16.7 -          -        -       R          #> 14     8.3 C          -        -       -
